title: 820-3115 Sound problem
message:
we have a board with U6201 dead. some burning traces are on pins 38 and 39.
lost DZ6704 and DZ6705

I repair the area and change the two DZ and I changed and repair the area of the U6201.

Now we have sound (chime) on the boot and immediately a "crash sound" after the chime like a disconnection. And on the OS X there are no sound card just the spdif outpout.

We don't now how to find the problem. Thanks to help us :-)

title: 820-3115 Sound problem
message: this could be a bad headphone jack, do you have sound on headphones??, remove R6805 and check if sound comes back...

title: 820-3115 Sound problem
message:
No. Same problem
......." TAC ! Chime ! TAC ! "

title: 820-3115 Sound problem
message: Sounds like a 4.5V analog issue. Check output from U6200.

title: 820-3115 Sound problem
message:
always the same problem. The output was ok on u6200 and I test all pin on the u6201 .
Does it possible to test the jack ?

title: 820-3115 Sound problem
message: Audio jack will not cause distortion on audio through speakers. Is the 4.5V getting to U6201? Are all other supply voltages getting to U6201? Was U6201 replaced?

title: 820-3115 Sound problem
message: i have 0v on CS4206_VREF_ADC

title: 820-3115 Sound problem
message: I'm not sure what that should be but it seems to be for A/D conversion which would be tied in with the 4.5V supply. I still have no clear answer if you have 4.5V on pin 24,25 U6201.

title: 820-3115 Sound problem
message: Does it possible that the problem was on the CPU?

title: 820-3115 Sound problem
message: Oh my god, please answer the questions asked...

title: 820-3115 Sound problem
message:
Yes sorry the 4.5v was on the pins 24 and 25

perhaps the U6400 was the problem ? Does it possible to test it ? or does it possible to disconnect it and what we can see in this case on OS X ? I find this logic board with dead  DZ6704 and DZ6705 and output 38 and 39 of the U6201 and the U6400 was on the way

title: 820-3115 Sound problem
message: Remove R6805 and see if audio works on speakers again.

title: 820-3115 Sound problem
message: I find the pin 2 of the R6805 disconnected. So the test was the same and I solder this pin but it is the same result. A "slash" or "tac"before and after the bip sound when I don't place DDR or before and after the chime  :-(

title: 820-3115 Sound problem
message:
I do not quite understand what you mean. You can leave R6805 out, it is only needed for SPDIF and no one uses this. Can you make a video of this "sound"?
Does audio work in OSX with R6805 removed?

title: 820-3115 Sound problem
message:
I have replaced the U6201 and removed the R6805 and the result was the same.
for the video I have a message here "invalid file". And same message with just audio :-(

title: 820-3115 Sound problem
message: Upload to youtube or google. The forum does not support such large files.

title: 820-3115 Sound problem
message: here :

title: 820-3115 Sound problem
message: It is possible that U6400 is pulling down the REF voltage for U6201. Is there low resistance/short on HPAMP_REF. You can remove U6400 too, just a mic will not work anymore but who cares about that.

title: 820-3115 Sound problem
message:
I found 64kohm on HPAMP_REF. I have remove the U6400.

no change.

title: 820-3115 Sound problem
message:
I have changed the J6700 and under this I found a hole on the circuit board. I have repaired the circuit for this J6700 and replace the J6700. Now I have the sound on the left and right channel on the head set or on the MBP speakers but I found the same problem on the start and the stop of the sound playing. "Tchak...... tchak"

Other ideas please. 

and thanks for all. I am just a junior :-)

title: 820-3115 Sound problem
message: What kind of "hole". It is very possible that if the board was burned that there is some kind a short inside the board.

title: 820-3115 Sound problem
message:
and does it possible to find the internal board view ?

The first problem was a high Courant gone through the jack connector. I don't know how but it is clearly the first problem.

title: 820-3115 Sound problem
message: Nope, there is no "internal" board view. If you really have time to waste you can dig into a donor board and see what is there. But this is just not a feasible repair for a single repair.
